overview: Ali Jafari (Persian: Ø¹Ù„ÛŒ Ø¬Ø¹ÙØ±ÛŒ), is professor of Computer and Information Technology, Adjunct Professor of Informatics, and Director of the CyberLab at Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI). He is one the early developers and inventors of the eLearning software technology called Course Management System or CMS. He is the creator and Principal Investigator (PI) of three major and most popular CMS and professional networking environments including the Oncourse (now known as Sakai Project), ANGEL Learning and the EpsilenEnvironment. in 2000 Jafari founded the ANGEL Learning Inc. In 2009, the ANGEL Learning Inc. was purchased by Blackboard Inc.
